intro: Baccaurea platyphylloides, commonly known as the flat-leaf baccaurea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and research settings.
